title: About
background-title: I care as much about user experience as I do about the quality of the technical foundations.
background: My goal is to build software that is pleasant to use today and reasonable to maintain tomorrow. While I work with a variety of tools, I care most about mastering foundational concepts that guide maintainable and scalable design.
philosophy-title: I approach each project with a pragmatic and thoughtful mindset.
philosophy: Rather than applying tools or patterns out of habit or personal preferences, I focus on understanding real needs, contextual constraints, and the trade-offs involved. This approach allows me to design architectures that are simple, coherent, and able to evolve without unnecessary complexity.
interests-title: I see quality as a continuous process.
interests: It involves attention to detail, testing, and regularly questioning my technical decisions. I strive to continuously improve the way I design and maintain applications, while staying grounded in the practical limits and realities of software development.
projects-disclaimer: The projects below are intentionally small in scope, with an emphasis on correctness, clarity, and operability over premature scale.
